reviews.review_msg: Really nice, easygoing guy. I like the way he has us choose our own readings from the library. Yes, some statements he makes in 325 are difficult to credit, but he tells you from the beginning that the lectures he presents are an argument, not "the truth." I learned a lot from these classes and would take another class with him.

I don't see all the hype that other students have experienced with Teeps. I finished an assignment a week before submission, and I met with him to review the thesis, and general idea, yet he gave me a B-. He seems stickler, and keeps students 5 minutes after each class. I ended up with a B+ thankfully, but I didn't enjoy his class.
